steps.description: Whisk together water, oil, honey, and salt.

Add 3/4 cup flour and the yeast. Mix until it's mostly incorporated. Add half the remaining flour and knead in a stand mixer fitted with the dough hook. You don't necessarily have to use a stand mixer-- you can do it by hand. Just knead normally. Add the remaining flour and knead for about 5 minutes.
Let rise in a greased bowl covered with plastic wrap for 30 minutes in a warm place.

Plop dough out onto a floured surface and divide in half. Roll each until it's 9 inches wide by about 30 inches long. Roll it up and put it into a greased 9x5 loaf pan. Let rise, covered, for 30 minutes in a warm place (or about 2 hours in the fridge if you want to slow down the rising time... I did this and it rose _beautifully_!)
Bake at 350 for about 30 minutes, or until it sounds hollow when you tap the tops of the loaves.
Optional: brush finished loaves with butter (This probably _shouldn't_ be optional because... butter)
